projects.title: FlashMind
projects.summary: A flashcard-based web application for repetitive learning
features: Learning mode that supports memorization through repetition
contribution: Designed and implemented the overall UI/UX
Integrated database and user authentication using Supabase
Controlled global state and learning flow using Zustand
problemSolving: Implemented secure data retrieval per user using Supabase RLS
Resolved Zustand hydration mismatch issues during SSR
learning: Understanding of SSR/CSR behavior in Next.js
Simple and effective state management with Zustand
Role-based security and access control with Supabase

projects.title: Over The Glass
projects.summary: A real-time subtitle service using AR glasses for the hearing impaired
features: Conversation Mode: Displays subtitles around the speaker with chat room support
Conversation History: Records who said what during conversations
Video Watching Mode: Identifies the speaker in videos and displays subtitles nearby
contribution: Led planning and frontend development as team leader and implemented the AR application
Analyzed open-source documentation and example code for unfamiliar technologies such as AR glasses, Flask, Dlib, and STT
Implemented real-time subtitles based on speaker position using knowledge of networking, image processing, 3D coordinates, and shared resources
problemSolving: Prevented stack overflow in image processing by applying mutex locks
Improved speaker tracking accuracy in 3D space through adaptive threshold tuning and frame sampling techniques
learning: Unity’s AR Foundation and UI rendering

projects.title: Duktown
projects.summary: A community-based app for sharing dormitory-related information
features: Provides dormitory-related info and supports applications (e.g. overnight stays, maintenance requests)
Dorm resident community, group delivery matching, and chat features
contribution: Implemented community pages including post CRUD and UI
Developed My Page with user info display and edit functionality
problemSolving: Improved user experience by dynamically configuring API requests based on query parameters and syncing state with URL for category-specific post loading
Implemented infinite scroll with `ref` and `onScroll` logic to handle pagination smoothly
Used an enum-like object to clearly differentiate categories such as 'Delivery', 'Daily', and 'Marketplace' and mapped them correctly to server API requests
learning: Learned structured dynamic page rendering and routing using React Router and state management hooks (useState, useEffect)
Managed accessToken in `localStorage` and learned to handle redirection for unauthenticated access in token-based authentication flow
Gained experience in user-centered UI logic through conditional rendering, scroll event handling, and use of useRef

projects.title: Time.zip
projects.summary: A self-development web app for students' commute and free time
features: Provides curated content such as newsletters and online lectures for self-improvement
learning: Improved collaboration by experiencing planning-design-development during a short hackathon
Learned asynchronous processing with axios for Rest API integration

projects.title: Focus Up
projects.summary: A gamified routine management app to boost focus and achievement
features: Users can create and manage routines
Routine missions progress like a game
Reward system upon routine goal completion
contribution: Developed Rest APIs for the home screen, character view, my room, and shop features using Spring Boot
learning: Implemented maintainable MVC architecture by separating Controller–Service–Repository layers
Learned backend development using Spring Boot, MySQL, and JPA
